Comments_List: I learnt a lot about early American history
I learned a lot about property rights, about what kinds of property right regimes lead to efficient development, and how American property rights developed.
The course gave us different perspectives on property, from colonial America to modern blockchain

I think the course was strong in that it was very focused and cohesive. I was left wanting for more critiques of private property rights (it isn't lost on me that most thinkers we read are famously pro-free market). I also felt the reading load was heavier than most courses I have taken.
Yes, it's a great class learn about early American history and to discuss theories underlying property
I would, as long as one understood that the course is geared towards thinking about property rights, not necessarily a conception of property itself.
